Description: Foot and lower wall of Attic pottery black-glazed, stamped bolsal. Wholly glazed save for reserved disc underfoot. Frieze of originally twelve stamped palmettes, simply linked, on floor. Incised inscription.
Curator's comments: A fragment has been lost since it was drawn for Edgar.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 113)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 704, no. 627)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1866)
